newsitem.title: USA: Compaq sees strong 2nd half, profits up.
newsitem.headline: Compaq sees strong 2nd half, profits up.

text.p: Compaq Computer Corp said on Wednesday it continues to expects a strong second half and is confident its current business model will enable it to gain market share and improve profitability.
Compaq today reported third quarter earnings of $1.25 a share, well above the First Call consensus estimate of $1.07.

"We're very pleased with Compaq's continuing solid financial performance and especially with improvements in earnings and the growth of gross margins to 23.8 percent (of revenues)," said Eckhard Pfeiffer, Compaq president and CEO.
He said in a statement that a number of developments were working in Compaq's favor.
Its options business, which includes monitors, hard drives, keyboards, CD changers and other accessories, remains one of its most profitable and has grown significantly in the third quarter, he said.

Compaq said it now has the strongest line-up of products and strategic partnerships in its history, and at the end of October it plans to launch workstations that run Microsoft Corp's Windows NT operating system, priced far less than other workstations, for engineering and financial users.
